enhanced_by.reason: The ifPresent method depends on the value being set, so it should be invoked after setValue to ensure the value is present.
The whenSet method depends on the value being set, so it should be invoked after setValue to ensure the value is set.
The isPresent method checks if the value is present, which can be used to assert the state of the value after setValue.
The isValueSet method checks if the value has been set, which can be used to assert the state of the value after setValue.
The get method retrieves the value, which can be used to assert the value after setValue.
